Complete Step-by-Step Guide

üìÅ 1Ô∏è‚É£ Initial Setup & Preparation

3 steps
1.1
Install GitHub CLI

Purpose: Command-line interface for GitHub operations

macOS: brew install gh
Ubuntu/Debian: sudo apt install gh
Windows: winget install GitHub.cli

Verify: gh --version

1.2
Authenticate with GitHub

Purpose: Establish secure connection to GitHub

Command: gh auth login

Choose:

  • GitHub.com
  • HTTPS
  • Yes (authenticate Git)
  • Login with web browser

Verify: gh auth status

1.3
Configure Repository

Purpose: Set up project for GitHub Actions

Check remote: git remote -v
Verify connection: gh repo view

Expected output: Should show your repository details

üìÅ 2Ô∏è‚É£ Environment Configuration

3 steps
2.1
Set up Staging Environment

Purpose: Create safe testing environment

Create staging branch: git checkout -b staging
Push staging branch: git push -u origin staging

Configure: Set up staging server and database

2.2
Configure Production Environment

Purpose: Set up live production environment

Create production branch: git checkout -b production
Push production branch: git push -u origin production

Configure: Set up production server and database

2.3
Set up SSH Keys

Purpose: Secure server access for deployment

Generate SSH key: ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "github-actions-deploy"
Copy public key: cat ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub

Add to server: Copy public key to server's authorized_keys

üìÅ 3Ô∏è‚É£ GitHub Secrets Configuration

2 steps
3.1
Configure Server Secrets

Purpose: Store server access credentials securely

Add SSH private key: gh secret set SSH_PRIVATE_KEY --body-file ~/.ssh/id_ed25519
Add server host: gh secret set SERVER_HOST --body "your-server.com"
Add server user: gh secret set SERVER_USER --body "deploy"

Verify: gh secret list

3.2
Configure Database Secrets

Purpose: Store database connection credentials

Add database host: gh secret set DB_HOST --body "localhost"
Add database name: gh secret set DB_DATABASE --body "your_database"
Add database user: gh secret set DB_USERNAME --body "db_user"
Add database password: gh secret set DB_PASSWORD --body "your_password"

üìÅ 4Ô∏è‚É£ First Deployment

3 steps
4.1
Test Staging Deployment

Purpose: Verify deployment process works

Push to staging: git push origin staging

Monitor: Check GitHub Actions tab for deployment progress

Verify: Visit staging URL to confirm deployment success

4.2
Deploy to Production

Purpose: Deploy to live production environment

Push to production: git push origin production

Monitor: Watch deployment progress in GitHub Actions

Verify: Check production site functionality

4.3
Run Health Checks

Purpose: Verify deployment health and functionality

Check website: curl -I https://yourdomain.com
Check database: php artisan tinker --execute="DB::connection()->getPdo();"

Verify: All critical functionality working correctly

Essential Commands & Scripts

üîß GitHub CLI Commands

1Ô∏è‚É£ Authentication & Setup

Login: gh auth login
Check status: gh auth status
Logout: gh auth logout

2Ô∏è‚É£ Repository Management

View repo: gh repo view
Clone repo: gh repo clone owner/repo
Create repo: gh repo create repo-name --public

3Ô∏è‚É£ Secrets Management

List secrets: gh secret list
Set secret: gh secret set SECRET_NAME --body "value"
Delete secret: gh secret delete SECRET_NAME

üöÄ Deployment Commands

1Ô∏è‚É£ Git Operations

Check status: git status
Add changes: git add .
Commit changes: git commit -m "Deploy to production"
Push to branch: git push origin production

2Ô∏è‚É£ Laravel Commands

Clear cache: php artisan cache:clear
Config cache: php artisan config:cache
Route cache: php artisan route:cache
View cache: php artisan view:cache

üõ†Ô∏è Server Commands

1Ô∏è‚É£ SSH & Server Access

Connect to server: ssh user@your-server.com
Check server info: uname -a
Check disk space: df -h
Check memory: free -h

2Ô∏è‚É£ Process Management

Check processes: ps aux | grep php
Kill process: kill -9 PID
Restart service: sudo systemctl restart nginx
